description.narrative: The project is investing in rehabilitation and expansion of sewerage network, modernization and expansion of wastewater treatment plants (WWTPs), and improvement of wastewater management in the Kathmandu Valley that will help improve service delivery and reduce pollution of the Bagmati River and its tributaries. The project is also strengthening the institutions working for wastewater management in the Kathmandu Valley to increase operational efficiency and improve service delivery, and will result in positive impacts on health and quality of life for the residents of Kathmandu Valley. The project is coordinating with other related projects to fulfill the medium-term priority investment needs identified in the long-term capital investment and asset management program.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Water Supply (formerly Ministry of Water Supply and Sanitation)

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Improved access to, and efficiency of, wastewater services for the residents of Kathmandu Valley.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

New sewer connections provided to 58,850 buildings (168,900 households) (Target: 30% of new beneficiaries are from poor households; 100% of households in the service area headed by women are benefitted).

description.narrative: Improved access to, and efficiency of, wastewater services for the residents of Kathmandu Valley.

title.narrative: Wastewater treatment capacity increased from 16.4 MLD in 2012 to 90.5 MLD in 2018.

description.narrative: Improved access to, and efficiency of, wastewater services for the residents of Kathmandu Valley.

title.narrative: Samples of effluent from wastewater treatment plants complying with national effluent standards increased from less than 5% in 2012 to almost 100% in 2018.

description.narrative: Improved access to, and efficiency of, wastewater services for the residents of Kathmandu Valley.

title.narrative: By the end of the project (by 2018) Collection of sewage through sewerage network increased from less than 5% in 2012 to more than 80% in 2018.

description.narrative: Improved access to, and efficiency of, wastewater services for the residents of Kathmandu Valley.
